Let $A_1,\,A_2,\,A_3,\,...\subseteq S$ be an infinite sequence of possibly overlapping events in some probability space.

a.  Define a new sequence of events $B_i=A_i\cap \left(\bigcup_{j=1}^{i-1}A_j\right)^c$, and show that these are pairwise disjoint.

b.  Show that

$$
\bigcup_{i=1}^\infty A_i=\bigcup_{i=1}^\infty B_i.
$$

c.  Use the previous parts to show that

$$
P\left(\bigcup_{i=1}^\infty A_i\right)\leq\sum\limits_{i=1}^\infty P(A_i).
$$
